get.summary: Returns OK if healthy.
Returns OK if healthy and fully caught up.
Return metrics about algod functioning.

get.description: Returns the entire genesis file in json.
get.summary: Gets the genesis information.

get.description: Returns the entire swagger spec in json.
get.summary: Gets the current swagger spec.

get.description: Retrieves the supported API versions, binary build versions, and genesis information.
Retrieves the current settings for blocking and mutex profiles

put.description: Enables blocking and mutex profiles, and returns the old settings

get.description: Returns the merged (defaults + overrides) config file in json.

200.description: The merged config file in json.

get.description: Given a specific account public key, this call returns the account's status, balance and spendable amounts
get.summary: Get account information.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: When set to `all` will exclude asset holdings, application local state, created asset parameters, any created application parameters. Defaults to `none`.

get.description: Given a specific account public key and asset ID, this call returns the account's asset holding and asset parameters (if either exist). Asset parameters will only be returned if the provided address is the asset's creator.
get.summary: Get account information about a given asset.

get.description: Lookup an account's asset holdings.
get.summary: Get a list of assets held by an account, inclusive of asset params.

get.description: Given a specific account public key and application ID, this call returns the account's application local state and global state (AppLocalState and AppParams, if either exists). Global state will only be returned if the provided address is the application's creator.
get.summary: Get account information about a given app.

get.description: Get the list of pending transactions by address, sorted by priority, in decreasing order, truncated at the end at MAX. If MAX = 0, returns all pending transactions.
get.summary: Get a list of unconfirmed transactions currently in the transaction pool by address.

400.description: Max must be a non-negative integer

get.summary: Get the block for the given round.

parameters.description: If true, only the block header (exclusive of payset or certificate) may be included in response.
parameters.name: header-only

get.summary: Get the top level transaction IDs for the block on the given round.
Get the block hash for the block on the given round.
Get a proof for a transaction in a block.

parameters.description: The transaction ID for which to generate a proof.
parameters.name: txid

parameters.description:
The type of hash function used to create the proof, must be one of: 
* sha512_256 
* sha256
parameters.name: hashtype

400.description: Malformed round number or transaction ID

500.description: Internal error, including protocol not supporting proofs.

get.description: Get all of the logs from outer and inner app calls in the given round
get.summary: Get all of the logs from outer and inner app calls in the given round
Get the current supply reported by the ledger.

get.description: Return a list of participation keys
get.summary: Return a list of participation keys

post.summary: Add a participation key to the node

parameters.description: The participation key to add to the node
parameters.name: participationkey

parameters.description: Key dilution for two-level participation keys (defaults to sqrt of validity window).

parameters.description: First round for participation key.

parameters.description: Last round for participation key.

200.description: An empty JSON object is returned if the generation process was started. Currently no status is available.

delete.description: Delete a given participation key by ID
delete.summary: Delete a given participation key by ID

200.description: Participation key got deleted by ID

parameters.name: keymap

post.summary: Append state proof keys to a participation key

post.description: Special management endpoint to shutdown the node. Optionally provide a timeout parameter to indicate that the node should begin shutting down after a number of seconds.

get.summary: Gets the current node status.

get.description: Waits for a block to appear after round {round} and returns the node's status at the time. There is a 1 minute timeout, when reached the current status is returned regardless of whether or not it is the round after the given round.
get.summary: Gets the node status after waiting for a round after the given round.

200.description: The round after the given round, or the current round if a timeout occurs.

400.description: Bad Request -- number must be non-negative integer

post.summary: Broadcasts a raw transaction or transaction group to the network.

parameters.description: The byte encoded signed transaction to broadcast to network
parameters.name: rawtxn

post.summary: Fast track for broadcasting a raw transaction or transaction group to the network through the tx handler without performing most of the checks and reporting detailed errors. Should be only used for development and performance testing.

parameters.description: The byte encoded signed transaction to broadcast to network
parameters.name: rawtxn

404.description: Developer or Experimental API not enabled

post.summary: Simulates a raw transaction or transaction group as it would be evaluated on the network. The simulation will use blockchain state from the latest committed round.

parameters.description: The transactions to simulate, along with any other inputs.
parameters.name: request

get.summary: Get parameters for constructing a new transaction

get.description: Get the list of pending transactions, sorted by priority, in decreasing order, truncated at the end at MAX. If MAX = 0, returns all pending transactions.
get.summary: Get a list of unconfirmed transactions currently in the transaction pool.

get.description:
Given a transaction ID of a recently submitted transaction, it returns information about it.  There are several cases when this might succeed:
- transaction committed (committed round > 0)
- transaction still in the pool (committed round = 0, pool error = "")
- transaction removed from pool due to error (committed round = 0, pool error != "")
Or the transaction may have happened sufficiently long ago that the node no longer remembers it, and this will return an error.
get.summary: Get a specific pending transaction.

parameters.description: A transaction ID
parameters.name: txid

200.description:
Given a transaction ID of a recently submitted transaction, it returns information about it.  There are several cases when this might succeed:
- transaction committed (committed round > 0)
- transaction still in the pool (committed round = 0, pool error = "")
- transaction removed from pool due to error (committed round = 0, pool error != "")

Or the transaction may have happened sufficiently long ago that the node no longer remembers it, and this will return an error.

get.description: Get ledger deltas for a round.
get.summary: Get a LedgerStateDelta object for a given round

404.description: Could not find a delta for round

get.description: Get ledger deltas for transaction groups in a given round.
get.summary: Get LedgerStateDelta objects for all transaction groups in a given round

404.description: Could not find deltas for round

get.description: Get a ledger delta for a given transaction group.
get.summary: Get a LedgerStateDelta object for a given transaction group

parameters.description: A transaction ID, or transaction group ID
parameters.name: id

404.description: Could not find a delta for transaction ID or group ID

get.summary: Get a state proof that covers a given round

404.description: Could not find a state proof that covers a given round

get.summary: Gets a proof for a given light block header inside a state proof commitment

404.description: Could not create proof since some data is missing

get.description: Given a application ID, it returns application information including creator, approval and clear programs, global and local schemas, and global state.
get.summary: Get application information.

get.description: Given an application ID, return all Box names. No particular ordering is guaranteed. Request fails when client or server-side configured limits prevent returning all Box names.
get.summary: Get all box names for a given application.

parameters.description: Max number of box names to return. If max is not set, or max == 0, returns all box-names.
parameters.name: max

get.description: Given an application ID and box name, it returns the round, box name, and value (each base64 encoded). Box names must be in the goal app call arg encoding form 'encoding:value'. For ints, use the form 'int:1234'. For raw bytes, use the form 'b64:A=='. For printable strings, use the form 'str:hello'. For addresses, use the form 'addr:XYZ...'.
get.summary: Get box information for a given application.

parameters.description: A box name, in the goal app call arg form 'encoding:value'. For ints, use the form 'int:1234'. For raw bytes, use the form 'b64:A=='. For printable strings, use the form 'str:hello'. For addresses, use the form 'addr:XYZ...'.
parameters.name: name

get.description: Given a asset ID, it returns asset information including creator, name, total supply and special addresses.
get.summary: Get asset information.

delete.summary: Removes minimum sync round restriction from the ledger.

get.description: Gets the minimum sync round for the ledger.
get.summary: Returns the minimum sync round the ledger is keeping in cache.

post.description: Sets the minimum sync round on the ledger.
post.summary: Given a round, tells the ledger to keep that round in its cache.

400.description: Can not set sync round to an earlier round than the current round.

post.description: Given TEAL source code in plain text, return base64 encoded program bytes and base32 SHA512_256 hash of program bytes (Address style). This endpoint is only enabled when a node's configuration file sets EnableDeveloperAPI to true.
post.summary: Compile TEAL source code to binary, produce its hash

parameters.description: TEAL source code to be compiled
parameters.name: source
sourcemap
parameters.description: When set to `true`, returns the source map of the program as a JSON. Defaults to `false`.

post.description: Given the program bytes, return the TEAL source code in plain text. This endpoint is only enabled when a node's configuration file sets EnableDeveloperAPI to true.
post.summary: Disassemble program bytes into the TEAL source code.

parameters.description: TEAL program binary to be disassembled
parameters.name: source

post.description: Given a catchpoint, it starts catching up to this catchpoint

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: Specify the minimum number of blocks which the ledger must be advanced by in order to start the catchup. This is useful for simplifying tools which support fast catchup, they can run the catchup unconditionally and the node will skip the catchup if it is not needed.

delete.description: Given a catchpoint, it aborts catching up to this catchpoint

post.description: Executes TEAL program(s) in context and returns debugging information about the execution. This endpoint is only enabled when a node's configuration file sets EnableDeveloperAPI to true.
post.summary: Provide debugging information for a transaction (or group).

parameters.description: Transaction (or group) and any accompanying state-simulation data.
parameters.name: request

get.summary: Returns OK if experimental API is enabled.

get.description: Gets the current timestamp offset.
get.summary: Returns the timestamp offset. Timestamp offsets can only be set in dev mode.

post.description: Sets the timestamp offset (seconds) for blocks in dev mode. Providing an offset of 0 will unset this value and try to use the real clock for the timestamp.
post.summary: Given a timestamp offset in seconds, adds the offset to every subsequent block header's timestamp.

parameters.description: The timestamp offset for blocks in dev mode.
parameters.name: offset

400.description: Cannot set timestamp offset to a negative integer.

LedgerStateDeltaForTransactionGroup.description: Contains a ledger delta for a single transaction group

Account.description:
Account information at a given round.

Definition:
data/basics/userBalance.go : AccountData

amount.description: \[algo\] total number of MicroAlgos in the account

min-balance.description:
MicroAlgo balance required by the account.

The requirement grows based on asset and application usage.

amount-without-pending-rewards.description: specifies the amount of MicroAlgos in the account, without the pending rewards.

apps-local-state.description:
\[appl\] applications local data stored in this account.

Note the raw object uses `map[int] -> AppLocalState` for this type.

total-apps-opted-in.description: The count of all applications that have been opted in, equivalent to the count of application local data (AppLocalState objects) stored in this account.

apps-total-schema.description:
\[tsch\] stores the sum of all of the local schemas and global schemas in this account.

Note: the raw account uses `StateSchema` for this type.

apps-total-extra-pages.description: \[teap\] the sum of all extra application program pages for this account.

assets.description:
\[asset\] assets held by this account.

Note the raw object uses `map[int] -> AssetHolding` for this type.

total-assets-opted-in.description: The count of all assets that have been opted in, equivalent to the count of AssetHolding objects held by this account.

created-apps.description:
\[appp\] parameters of applications created by this account including app global data.

Note: the raw account uses `map[int] -> AppParams` for this type.

total-created-apps.description: The count of all apps (AppParams objects) created by this account.

created-assets.description:
\[apar\] parameters of assets created by this account.

Note: the raw account uses `map[int] -> Asset` for this type.

total-created-assets.description: The count of all assets (AssetParams objects) created by this account.

total-boxes.description: \[tbx\] The number of existing boxes created by this account's app.

total-box-bytes.description: \[tbxb\] The total number of bytes used by this account's app's box keys and values.

incentive-eligible.description: Whether or not the account can receive block incentives if its balance is in range at proposal time.

pending-rewards.description: amount of MicroAlgos of pending rewards in this account.

reward-base.description: \[ebase\] used as part of the rewards computation. Only applicable to accounts which are participating.

rewards.description: \[ern\] total rewards of MicroAlgos the account has received, including pending rewards.

round.description: The round for which this information is relevant.

status.description:
\[onl\] delegation status of the account's MicroAlgos
* Offline - indicates that the associated account is delegated.
*  Online  - indicates that the associated account used as part of the delegation pool.
*   NotParticipating - indicates that the associated account is neither a delegator nor a delegate.

sig-type.description:
Indicates what type of signature is used by this account, must be one of:
* sig
* msig
* lsig

auth-addr.description: \[spend\] the address against which signing should be checked. If empty, the address of the current account is used. This field can be updated in any transaction by setting the RekeyTo field.

last-proposed.description: The round in which this account last proposed the block.

last-heartbeat.description: The round in which this account last went online, or explicitly renewed their online status.

AccountAssetHolding.description: AccountAssetHolding describes the account's asset holding and asset parameters (if either exist) for a specific asset ID.

asset-holding.description:
\[asset\] Details about the asset held by this account.

The raw account uses `AssetHolding` for this type.

asset-params.description:
\[apar\] parameters of the asset held by this account.

The raw account uses `AssetParams` for this type.

AccountParticipation.description: AccountParticipation describes the parameters used by this account in consensus protocol.

selection-participation-key.description: \[sel\] Selection public key (if any) currently registered for this round.

vote-first-valid.description: \[voteFst\] First round for which this participation is valid.

vote-key-dilution.description: \[voteKD\] Number of subkeys in each batch of participation keys.

vote-last-valid.description: \[voteLst\] Last round for which this participation is valid.

vote-participation-key.description: \[vote\] root participation public key (if any) currently registered for this round.

state-proof-key.description: \[stprf\] Root of the state proof key (if any)

Asset.description: Specifies both the unique identifier and the parameters for an asset

AssetHolding.description:
Describes an asset held by an account.

Definition:
data/basics/userBalance.go : AssetHolding

is-frozen.description: \[f\] whether or not the holding is frozen.

AssetParams.description:
AssetParams specifies the parameters for an asset.

\[apar\] when part of an AssetConfig transaction.

Definition:
data/transactions/asset.go : AssetParams

clawback.description: \[c\] Address of account used to clawback holdings of this asset.  If empty, clawback is not permitted.

creator.description: The address that created this asset. This is the address where the parameters for this asset can be found, and also the address where unwanted asset units can be sent in the worst case.

decimals.description: \[dc\] The number of digits to use after the decimal point when displaying this asset. If 0, the asset is not divisible. If 1, the base unit of the asset is in tenths. If 2, the base unit of the asset is in hundredths, and so on. This value must be between 0 and 19 (inclusive).

default-frozen.description: \[df\] Whether holdings of this asset are frozen by default.

freeze.description: \[f\] Address of account used to freeze holdings of this asset.  If empty, freezing is not permitted.

manager.description: \[m\] Address of account used to manage the keys of this asset and to destroy it.

metadata-hash.description: \[am\] A commitment to some unspecified asset metadata. The format of this metadata is up to the application.

name.description: \[an\] Name of this asset, as supplied by the creator. Included only when the asset name is composed of printable utf-8 characters.

name-b64.description: Base64 encoded name of this asset, as supplied by the creator.

reserve.description: \[r\] Address of account holding reserve (non-minted) units of this asset.

total.description: \[t\] The total number of units of this asset.

unit-name.description: \[un\] Name of a unit of this asset, as supplied by the creator. Included only when the name of a unit of this asset is composed of printable utf-8 characters.

unit-name-b64.description: Base64 encoded name of a unit of this asset, as supplied by the creator.

url.description: \[au\] URL where more information about the asset can be retrieved. Included only when the URL is composed of printable utf-8 characters.

url-b64.description: Base64 encoded URL where more information about the asset can be retrieved.

AssetHoldingReference.description: References an asset held by an account.

account.description: Address of the account holding the asset.

ApplicationLocalReference.description: References an account's local state for an application.

account.description: Address of the account with the local state.

app.description: Application ID of the local state application.

ApplicationStateSchema.description: Specifies maximums on the number of each type that may be stored.

ApplicationLocalState.description: Stores local state associated with an application.

id.description: The application which this local state is for.

ParticipationKey.description: Represents a participation key used by the node.

address.description: Address the key was generated for.

effective-first-valid.description: When registered, this is the first round it may be used.

effective-last-valid.description: When registered, this is the last round it may be used.

last-vote.description: Round when this key was last used to vote.

last-block-proposal.description: Round when this key was last used to propose a block.

last-state-proof.description: Round when this key was last used to generate a state proof.

key.description: Key information stored on the account.

TealKeyValueStore.description: Represents a key-value store for use in an application.

TealKeyValue.description: Represents a key-value pair in an application store.

type.description: \[tt\] value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint**
value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint64**

AvmKeyValue.description: Represents an AVM key-value pair in an application store.

ApplicationParams.description: Stores the global information associated with an application.

creator.description: The address that created this application. This is the address where the parameters and global state for this application can be found.

extra-program-pages.description: \[epp\] the amount of extra program pages available to this app.

version.description: \[v\] the number of updates to the application programs

size-sponsor.description: \[ss\] the account responsible for extra pages and global state MBR

DryrunState.description: Stores the TEAL eval step data

DryrunTxnResult.description: DryrunTxnResult contains any LogicSig or ApplicationCall program debug information and state updates from a dryrun.

logic-sig-disassembly.description: Disassembled lsig program line by line.

budget-added.description: Budget added during execution of app call transaction.

budget-consumed.description: Budget consumed during execution of app call transaction.

ErrorResponse.description: An error response with optional data field.

DryrunRequest.description: Request data type for dryrun endpoint. Given the Transactions and simulated ledger state upload, run TEAL scripts and return debugging information.

items.description: SignedTxn object. Must be canonically encoded.

protocol-version.description: ProtocolVersion specifies a specific version string to operate under, otherwise whatever the current protocol of the network this algod is running in.

round.description: Round is available to some TEAL scripts. Defaults to the current round on the network this algod is attached to.

latest-timestamp.description: LatestTimestamp is available to some TEAL scripts. Defaults to the latest confirmed timestamp this algod is attached to.

DryrunSource.description: DryrunSource is TEAL source text that gets uploaded, compiled, and inserted into transactions or application state.

field-name.description: FieldName is what kind of sources this is. If lsig then it goes into the transactions[this.TxnIndex].LogicSig. If approv or clearp it goes into the Approval Program or Clear State Program of application[this.AppIndex].

round.description: If provided, specifies the round preceding the simulation. State changes through this round will be used to run this simulation. Usually only the 4 most recent rounds will be available (controlled by the node config value MaxAcctLookback). If not specified, defaults to the latest available round.

allow-empty-signatures.description: Allows transactions without signatures to be simulated as if they had correct signatures.

allow-more-logging.description: Lifts limits on log opcode usage during simulation.

allow-unnamed-resources.description: Allows access to unnamed resources during simulation.

extra-opcode-budget.description: Applies extra opcode budget during simulation for each transaction group.

fix-signers.description: If true, signers for transactions that are missing signatures will be fixed during evaluation.

items.description: SignedTxn object. Must be canonically encoded.

SimulateTraceConfig.description: An object that configures simulation execution trace.

enable.description: A boolean option for opting in execution trace features simulation endpoint.

stack-change.description: A boolean option enabling returning stack changes together with execution trace during simulation.

scratch-change.description: A boolean option enabling returning scratch slot changes together with execution trace during simulation.

state-change.description: A boolean option enabling returning application state changes (global, local, and box changes) with the execution trace during simulation.

round.description: The round for which this information is relevant

BoxReference.description: References a box of an application.

app.description: Application ID which this box belongs to

Version.title: Version contains the current algod version.

DebugSettingsProf.description: algod mutex and blocking profiling state.
DebugSettingsProf.title: algod mutex and blocking profiling state.

block-rate.description: The rate of blocking events. The profiler aims to sample an average of one blocking event per rate nanoseconds spent blocked. To turn off profiling entirely, pass rate 0.

mutex-rate.description: The rate of mutex events. On average 1/rate events are reported. To turn off profiling entirely, pass rate 0

BuildVersion.title: BuildVersion contains the current algod build version information.

PendingTransactionResponse.description: Details about a pending transaction. If the transaction was recently confirmed, includes confirmation details like the round and reward details.

asset-index.description: The asset index if the transaction was found and it created an asset.

application-index.description: The application index if the transaction was found and it created an application.

close-rewards.description: Rewards in microalgos applied to the close remainder to account.

asset-closing-amount.description: The number of the asset's unit that were transferred to the close-to address.

confirmed-round.description: The round where this transaction was confirmed, if present.

pool-error.description: Indicates that the transaction was kicked out of this node's transaction pool (and specifies why that happened).  An empty string indicates the transaction wasn't kicked out of this node's txpool due to an error.

receiver-rewards.description: Rewards in microalgos applied to the receiver account.

sender-rewards.description: Rewards in microalgos applied to the sender account.

local-state-delta.description: Local state key/value changes for the application being executed by this transaction.

global-state-delta.description: Global state key/value changes for the application being executed by this transaction.

logs.description: Logs for the application being executed by this transaction.

inner-txns.description: Inner transactions produced by application execution.

SimulateTransactionGroupResult.description: Simulation result for an atomic transaction group

failure-message.description: If present, indicates that the transaction group failed and specifies why that happened

failed-at.description: If present, indicates which transaction in this group caused the failure. This array represents the path to the failing transaction. Indexes are zero based, the first element indicates the top-level transaction, and successive elements indicate deeper inner transactions.

app-budget-added.description: Total budget added during execution of app calls in the transaction group.

app-budget-consumed.description: Total budget consumed during execution of app calls in the transaction group.

SimulateTransactionResult.description: Simulation result for an individual transaction

app-budget-consumed.description: Budget used during execution of an app call transaction. This value includes budged used by inner app calls spawned by this transaction.

logic-sig-budget-consumed.description: Budget used during execution of a logic sig transaction.

fixed-signer.description: The account that needed to sign this transaction when no signature was provided and the provided signer was incorrect.

StateProof.description: Represents a state proof and its corresponding message
The encoded StateProof for the message.

LightBlockHeaderProof.description: Proof of membership and position of a light block header.

index.description: The index of the light block header in the vector commitment tree

treedepth.description: Represents the depth of the tree that is being proven, i.e. the number of edges from a leaf to the root.

StateProofMessage.description: Represents the message that the state proofs are attesting to.

BlockHeadersCommitment.description: The vector commitment root on all light block headers within a state proof interval.

VotersCommitment.description: The vector commitment root of the top N accounts to sign the next StateProof.

LnProvenWeight.description: An integer value representing the natural log of the proven weight with 16 bits of precision. This value would be used to verify the next state proof.

FirstAttestedRound.description: The first round the message attests to.

LastAttestedRound.description: The last round the message attests to.

SimulationEvalOverrides.description: The set of parameters and limits override during simulation. If this set of parameters is present, then evaluation parameters may differ from standard evaluation in certain ways.

allow-empty-signatures.description: If true, transactions without signatures are allowed and simulated as if they were properly signed.

allow-unnamed-resources.description: If true, allows access to unnamed resources during simulation.

max-log-calls.description: The maximum log calls one can make during simulation

max-log-size.description: The maximum byte number to log during simulation

extra-opcode-budget.description: The extra opcode budget added to each transaction group during simulation

fix-signers.description: If true, signers for transactions that are missing signatures will be fixed during evaluation.

ScratchChange.description: A write operation into a scratch slot.

ApplicationStateOperation.description: An operation against an application's global/local/box state.

app-state-type.description: Type of application state. Value `g` is **global state**, `l` is **local state**, `b` is **boxes**.

key.description: The key (name) of the global/local/box state.

account.description: For local state changes, the address of the account associated with the local state.
The address of the account associated with the local state.

ApplicationInitialStates.description: An application's initial global/local/box states that were accessed during simulation.

app-locals.description: An application's initial local states tied to different accounts.

SimulationOpcodeTraceUnit.description: The set of trace information and effect from evaluating a single opcode.

pc.description: The program counter of the current opcode being evaluated.

state-changes.description: The operations against the current application's states.

spawned-inners.description: The indexes of the traces for inner transactions spawned by this opcode, if any.

stack-pop-count.description: The number of deleted stack values by this opcode.

stack-additions.description: The values added by this opcode to the stack.

SimulationTransactionExecTrace.description: The execution trace of calling an app or a logic sig, containing the inner app call trace in a recursive way.

approval-program-trace.description: Program trace that contains a trace of opcode effects in an approval program.

approval-program-hash.description: SHA512_256 hash digest of the approval program executed in transaction.

clear-state-program-trace.description: Program trace that contains a trace of opcode effects in a clear state program.

clear-state-program-hash.description: SHA512_256 hash digest of the clear state program executed in transaction.

clear-state-rollback.description: If true, indicates that the clear state program failed and any persistent state changes it produced should be reverted once the program exits.

clear-state-rollback-error.description: The error message explaining why the clear state program failed. This field will only be populated if clear-state-rollback is true and the failure was due to an execution error.

logic-sig-trace.description: Program trace that contains a trace of opcode effects in a logic sig.

logic-sig-hash.description: SHA512_256 hash digest of the logic sig executed in transaction.

inner-trace.description: An array of SimulationTransactionExecTrace representing the execution trace of any inner transactions executed.

SimulateUnnamedResourcesAccessed.description: These are resources that were accessed by this group that would normally have caused failure, but were allowed in simulation. Depending on where this object is in the response, the unnamed resources it contains may or may not qualify for group resource sharing. If this is a field in SimulateTransactionGroupResult, the resources do qualify, but if this is a field in SimulateTransactionResult, they do not qualify. In order to make this group valid for actual submission, resources that qualify for group sharing can be made available by any transaction of the group; otherwise, resources must be placed in the same transaction which accessed them.

accounts.description: The unnamed accounts that were referenced. The order of this array is arbitrary.

assets.description: The unnamed assets that were referenced. The order of this array is arbitrary.

apps.description: The unnamed applications that were referenced. The order of this array is arbitrary.

boxes.description: The unnamed boxes that were referenced. The order of this array is arbitrary.

extra-box-refs.description: The number of extra box references used to increase the IO budget. This is in addition to the references defined in the input transaction group and any referenced to unnamed boxes.

asset-holdings.description: The unnamed asset holdings that were referenced. The order of this array is arbitrary.

app-locals.description: The unnamed application local states that were referenced. The order of this array is arbitrary.

SimulateInitialStates.description: Initial states of resources that were accessed during simulation.

app-initial-states.description: The initial states of accessed application before simulation. The order of this array is arbitrary.

AppCallLogs.description: The logged messages from an app call along with the app ID and outer transaction ID. Logs appear in the same order that they were emitted.

application-index.description: The application from which the logs were generated

txId.description: The transaction ID of the outer app call that lead to these logs

TransactionProof.description: Proof of transaction in a block.

stibhash.description: Hash of SignedTxnInBlock for verifying proof.

treedepth.description: Represents the depth of the tree that is being proven, i.e. the number of edges from a leaf to the root.

idx.description: Index of the transaction in the block's payset.

hashtype.description:
The type of hash function used to create the proof, must be one of: 
* sha512_256 
* sha256

format.description: Configures whether the response object is JSON or MessagePack encoded. If not provided, defaults to JSON.
format.name: format

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return.
limit.name: limit

max.description: Truncated number of transactions to display. If max=0, returns all pending txns.
max.name: max

next.description: The next page of results. Use the next token provided by the previous results.
next.name: next

sig-type.description:
SigType filters just results using the specified type of signature:
* sig - Standard
* msig - MultiSig
* lsig - LogicSig
sig-type.name: sig-type

tx-id.description: Lookup the specific transaction by ID.
tx-id.name: tx-id

GetBlockTimeStampOffsetResponse.description: Response containing the timestamp offset in seconds

GetSyncRoundResponse.description: Response containing the ledger's minimum sync round

round.description: The minimum sync round for the ledger.

LedgerStateDeltaForTransactionGroupRespo.description: Response containing a ledger state delta for a single transaction group.

TransactionGroupLedgerStateDeltasForRoun.description: Response containing all ledger state deltas for transaction groups, with their associated Ids, in a single round.

LightBlockHeaderProofResponse.description: Proof of a light block header.

StateProofResponse.description: StateProofResponse wraps the StateProof type in a response.

AccountResponse.description: AccountResponse wraps the Account type in a response.

AccountAssetResponse.description: AccountAssetResponse describes the account's asset holding and asset parameters (if either exist) for a specific asset ID. Asset parameters will only be returned if the provided address is the asset's creator.

round.description: The round for which this information is relevant.

asset-holding.description:
\[asset\] Details about the asset held by this account.

The raw account uses `AssetHolding` for this type.

created-asset.description:
\[apar\] parameters of the asset created by this account.

The raw account uses `AssetParams` for this type.

AccountAssetsInformationResponse.description: AccountAssetsInformationResponse contains a list of assets held by an account.

round.description: The round for which this information is relevant.

next-token.description: Used for pagination, when making another request provide this token with the next parameter.

AccountApplicationResponse.description: AccountApplicationResponse describes the account's application local state and global state (AppLocalState and AppParams, if either exists) for a specific application ID. Global state will only be returned if the provided address is the application's creator.

round.description: The round for which this information is relevant.

app-local-state.description:
\[appl\] the application local data stored in this account.

The raw account uses `AppLocalState` for this type.

created-app.description:
\[appp\] parameters of the application created by this account including app global data.

The raw account uses `AppParams` for this type.

cert.description: Optional certificate object. This is only included when the format is set to message pack.

BlockTxidsResponse.description: Top level transaction IDs in a block.

TransactionProofResponse.description: Proof of transaction in a block.

schema.description: NodeStatus contains the information about a node status

last-round.description: LastRound indicates the last round seen

last-version.description: LastVersion indicates the last consensus version supported

next-version.description: NextVersion of consensus protocol to use

next-version-round.description: NextVersionRound is the round at which the next consensus version will apply

next-version-supported.description: NextVersionSupported indicates whether the next consensus version is supported by this node

stopped-at-unsupported-round.description: StoppedAtUnsupportedRound indicates that the node does not support the new rounds and has stopped making progress

last-catchpoint.description: The last catchpoint seen by the node

catchpoint.description: The current catchpoint that is being caught up to

catchpoint-total-accounts.description: The total number of accounts included in the current catchpoint

catchpoint-processed-accounts.description: The number of accounts from the current catchpoint that have been processed so far as part of the catchup

catchpoint-verified-accounts.description: The number of accounts from the current catchpoint that have been verified so far as part of the catchup

catchpoint-total-kvs.description: The total number of key-values (KVs) included in the current catchpoint

catchpoint-processed-kvs.description: The number of key-values (KVs) from the current catchpoint that have been processed so far as part of the catchup

catchpoint-verified-kvs.description: The number of key-values (KVs) from the current catchpoint that have been verified so far as part of the catchup

catchpoint-total-blocks.description: The total number of blocks that are required to complete the current catchpoint catchup

catchpoint-acquired-blocks.description: The number of blocks that have already been obtained by the node as part of the catchup

upgrade-votes-required.description: Yes votes required for consensus upgrade

upgrade-votes.description: Total votes cast for consensus upgrade

upgrade-yes-votes.description: Yes votes cast for consensus upgrade

upgrade-no-votes.description: No votes cast for consensus upgrade

upgrade-vote-rounds.description: Total voting rounds for current upgrade

PendingTransactionsResponse.description: A potentially truncated list of transactions currently in the node's transaction pool. You can compute whether or not the list is truncated if the number of elements in the **top-transactions** array is fewer than **total-transactions**.

schema.description: PendingTransactions is an array of signed transactions exactly as they were submitted.

top-transactions.description: An array of signed transaction objects.

total-transactions.description: Total number of transactions in the pool.

ParticipationKeyResponse.description: A detailed description of a participation ID

SimulateResponse.description: Result of a transaction group simulation.

version.description: The version of this response object.

last-round.description: The round immediately preceding this simulation. State changes through this round were used to run this simulation.

txn-groups.description: A result object for each transaction group that was simulated.

BlockLogsResponse.description: All logs emitted in the given round. Each app call, whether top-level or inner, that contains logs results in a separate AppCallLogs object. Therefore there may be multiple AppCallLogs with the same application ID and outer transaction ID in the event of multiple inner app calls to the same app. App calls with no logs are not included in the response. AppCallLogs are returned in the same order that their corresponding app call appeared in the block (pre-order traversal of inner app calls)

SupplyResponse.description: Supply represents the current supply of MicroAlgos in the system.

schema.description: Supply represents the current supply of MicroAlgos in the system

TransactionParametersResponse.description: TransactionParams contains the parameters that help a client construct a new transaction.

schema.description:
TransactionParams contains the parameters that help a client construct
a new transaction.

consensus-version.description:
ConsensusVersion indicates the consensus protocol version
as of LastRound.

fee.description:
Fee is the suggested transaction fee
Fee is in units of micro-Algos per byte.
Fee may fall to zero but transactions must still have a fee of
at least MinTxnFee for the current network protocol.

genesis-hash.description: GenesisHash is the hash of the genesis block.

genesis-id.description: GenesisID is an ID listed in the genesis block.

last-round.description: LastRound indicates the last round seen

min-fee.description:
The minimum transaction fee (not per byte) required for the
txn to validate for the current network protocol.

hash.description: base32 SHA512_256 of program bytes (Address style)

DryrunResponse.description: DryrunResponse contains per-txn debug information from a dryrun.

protocol-version.description: Protocol version is the protocol version Dryrun was operated under.

DebugSettingsProfResponse.description: DebugPprof is the response to the /debug/extra/pprof endpoint

api_key.description: Generated header parameter. This token can be generated using the Goal command line tool. Example value ='b7e384d0317b8050ce45900a94a1931e28540e1f69b2d242b424659c341b4697'
api_key.name: X-Algo-API-Token
